text: // chap7h.cpp // Kbyron@bmcc. cuny . edu // last revised 2-24-2021 // C progrem to illustrate some C++ i-o and string class functions // cloned from chap7g.cpp #include <iostream> #include <string> using namespace std; int main () { string namel="yes", name2="yes"; while(!(namel=="no"&&name2=="no")){ cout << “enter 2 names separated by space (enter 'no no' when done) ... "; cin >> namel >> name2; int result = namel.compare(name2); cout << " namel = " << namel << " name2 = " << name2 << " result = " << result << endl; if(result==0) cout << namel << " = " << name2 << endl; else if(result<o) cout << namel << " < " << name2 << endl; else cout << namel << " > " << name2 << endl; if(namel>name2) cout << "namel is greater” << endl; else if(namel<name2) cout << "namel is less” << endl; else if(namel==name2) cout << "namel is equal” << endl; }
